sentences.sContent: When America boycotted the Moscow Olympics it cheapened the medals won.
sentences.sCn: 当美国抵制莫斯科奥运会时，所获奖牌的价值降低了。

sentences.sContent: Love is a word cheapened by overuse.
sentences.sCn: 爱情这个词因滥用而变得廉价了。

remMethod.val: cheap(便宜的) + en(动词后缀) → (使)便宜

trans.tranCn: 便宜； 贬损； 变得卑贱
trans.tranOther: If something cheapens a person or thing, it lowers their reputation or position
